content.raw: So if the file is two words, we should include an underscore between them in the header guards even if it's not separated in the class name or the file name? This is a large inconsistency across all the code.
content.html: So if the file is two words, we should include an underscore between them in the header guards even if it's not separated in the class name or the file name? This is a large inconsistency across all the code.

pullrequest.title: Changes to Doxygen comments and formatting PART 3: sdf, sensors, transport

content.raw:
Made some more changes. 

FYI: Using three forward slashes (///) is automatically interpreted as valid doxygen documentation. So "/// Documentation inherited" will replace the actual inherited documentation with "Documentation inherited". The solution is to use only two forward slashes.
content.html:
Made some more changes.

FYI: Using three forward slashes (///) is automatically interpreted as valid doxygen documentation. So "/// Documentation inherited" will replace the actual inherited documentation with "Documentation inherited". The solution is to use only two forward slashes.
